schema.name: Healthyfied Beef Tendon Kaldereta

recipeInstructions.text: Wash the beef tendon thoroughly and cut into bite-sized pieces.
Peel and chop the potato, red bell pepper, green bell pepper, and white onion into equal sizes to ensure even cooking.
In a pot, add the beef tendon and water. Bring to a boil and simmer for about 1 hour 30 minutes or until the tendon is tender.
Remove the tendon from the pot, set aside, and discard the water.
In the same pot, heat a little oil over medium heat and sauté the minced garlic until golden brown, about 2 minutes.
Add the cut vegetables (potato, red bell pepper, green bell pepper, and white onion) to the pot and sauté for another 5 minutes.
Return the beef tendon to the pot and add the tomato sauce, stirring well to combine. Season with black pepper and salt.
Cover the pot and let the kaldereta simmer on low heat for about 20 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and the sauce has thickened.
Serve your Healthyfied Beef Tendon Kaldereta hot and enjoy this nutritious twist on a classic Filipino comfort food.

schema.description: This Healthyfied Beef Tendon Kaldereta is a perfect combination of healthful eating and indulgent flavors. Designed for those who love high-protein and low-sugar diets, this recipe transforms a classic dish into a healthier alternative without compromising taste. Whether you're following a health-conscious lifestyle or simply looking for a nutritious meal, this healthy twist on the traditional Kaldereta is sure to impress.
